< Rules />

Rules

  1. Registration. Hackers must be a part-time or full-time student, either pre-collegiate, ungraduate, or graduate. Teams must register through our form before 11:59pm on March 22nd, and can only have one to four university students. Registration is free, first come, first serve, and limited by the space and resources available.

  2. Submitting hacks. Teams are allowed one submission that must be online by 12pm noon on April 14, 2013. All code must be written at the event by team members; any outside libraries must be freely available to all teams.

  3. Demoing. Demoing will take place in Davis 101 starting at 2:05pm. Each team will have an opportunity to present their hack for two minutes in front of judges and their peers. The UB Hacking organizers do not encourage the use of slides.

  4. Judging. The judges will rank hacks based off the following criteria: usefulness, technical difficulty, creativity, and polish.

  5. Ownership. The team owns the hack, but we may use your submitted hack for future UB Hacking promotions.

Thanks to our lead sponsor:
